items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: Microsoft expands Recall preview to Intel and AMD Copilot+ PCs
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: ​Microsoft is now testing its AI-powered Recall feature on AMD and Intel-powered Copilot+ PCs enrolled in the Windows 11 Insider program. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Ultralytics AI model hijacked to infect thousands with cryptominer
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: The popular Ultralytics YOLO11 AI model was compromised in a supply chain attack to deploy cryptominers on devices running versions 8.3.41 and 8.3.42 from the Python Package Index (PyPI)   [...]
items.contentSnippet: The popular Ultralytics YOLO11 AI model was compromised in a supply chain attack to deploy cryptominers on devices running versions 8.3.41 and 8.3.42 from the Python Package Index (PyPI)   [...]

items.title: Blue Yonder SaaS giant breached by Termite ransomware gang
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: ​The Termite ransomware gang has officially claimed responsibility for the November breach of software as a service (SaaS) provider Blue Yonder. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: New Windows zero-day exposes NTLM credentials, gets unofficial patch
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: A new zero-day vulnerability has been discovered that allows attackers to capture NTLM credentials by simply tricking the target into viewing a malicious file in Windows Explorer. [...]
items.contentSnippet: A new zero-day vulnerability has been discovered that allows attackers to capture NTLM credentials by simply tricking the target into viewing a malicious file in Windows Explorer. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Crypto-stealing malware posing as a meeting app targets Web3 pros
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: Cybercriminals are targeting people working in Web3 with fake business meetings using a fraudulent video conferencing platform that infects Windows and Macs with crypto-stealing malware. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Cybercriminals are targeting people working in Web3 with fake business meetings using a fraudulent video conferencing platform that infects Windows and Macs with crypto-stealing malware. [...]

items.title: Nebraska man pleads guilty to $3.5 million cryptojacking scheme

items.title: Romania's election systems targeted in over 85,000 cyberattacks

items.title: U.S. org suffered four month intrusion by Chinese hackers
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: A large U.S. organization with significant presence in China has been reportedly breached by China-based threat actors who persisted on its networks from April to August 2024. [...]

items.title: US arrests Scattered Spider suspect linked to telecom hacks
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: ​U.S. authorities have arrested a 19-year-old teenager linked to the notorious Scattered Spider cybercrime gang who is now charged with breaching a U.S. financial institution and two unnamed telecommunications firms. [...]
items.contentSnippet: ​U.S. authorities have arrested a 19-year-old teenager linked to the notorious Scattered Spider cybercrime gang who is now charged with breaching a U.S. financial institution and two unnamed telecommunications firms. [...]

items.title: Police shuts down Manson cybercrime market, arrests key suspects

items.content: German law enforcement has seized over 50 servers that hosted the Manson Market cybercrime marketplace and fake online shops used in phishing operations. [...]
items.contentSnippet: German law enforcement has seized over 50 servers that hosted the Manson Market cybercrime marketplace and fake online shops used in phishing operations. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: New Android spyware found on phone seized by Russian FSB
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: After a Russian programmer was detained by Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) for fifteen days and his phone confiscated, it was discovered that a new spyware was secretly installed on his device upon its return. [...]
items.contentSnippet: After a Russian programmer was detained by Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) for fifteen days and his phone confiscated, it was discovered that a new spyware was secretly installed on his device upon its return. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: Microsoft says having a TPM is "non-negotiable" for Windows 11
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Microsoft made it abundantly clear this week that Windows 10 users won't be able to upgrade to Windows 11 unless their systems come with TPM 2.0 support, stating it's a "non-negotiable" requirement. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: FBI shares tips on how to tackle AI-powered fraud schemes
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: The FBI warns that scammers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to improve the quality and effectiveness of their online fraud schemes, ranging from romance and investment scams to job hiring schemes. [...]

items.title: New DroidBot Android malware targets 77 banking, crypto apps
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

items.creator: Lawrence Abrams
items.title: Solana Web3.js library backdoored to steal secret, private keys
items.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
items.content: The legitimate Solana JavaScript SDK was temporarily compromised yesterday in a supply chain attack, with the library backdoored with malicious code to steal cryptocurrency private keys and drain wallets. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Russian hackers hijack Pakistani hackers' servers for their own attacks
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

items.title: Japan warns of IO-Data zero-day router flaws exploited in attacks
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

items.title: Korea arrests CEO for adding DDoS feature to satellite receivers

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: BootKitty UEFI malware exploits LogoFAIL to infect Linux systems
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware. [...]

items.title: Mozilla really wants you to set Firefox as default Windows browser
items.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
items.content: In an effort to turn the tide, Mozilla is testing a fresh approach that could persuade more people to switch their default browser on Windows during the installation of the browser. [...]
